{{DISPLAYTITLE:List of minor ''Emmerdale'' characters (2005)}} {{Emmerdaleminor}} The following is a '''list of minor characters''' that first appeared in the [[United Kingdom|British]] [[soap opera]] '''''[[Emmerdale]]''''' in 2005, by order of first appearance. ==Amy Carter== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Amy Carter |portrayer=Bethany Webb |years=2005 |first=3 January 2005 |last=7 January 2005 |romances=[[Max King (Emmerdale)|Max King]] (?-2005) }} '''Amy Carter''' was the girlfriend of [[Max King (Emmerdale)|Max King]]. Max and Amy had spent time traveling and arrive in the village for his father [[Tom King (Emmerdale)|Tom]]âs wedding to [[Charity Dingle]] before intending to travel to [[Thailand]] after visiting Amy's parents in Cornwall. The King family treats her with open contempt. The wedding ends in disaster, and Tom re-evaluates his life and demands that Max stay and get a job. Max agrees, and an upset Amy says she will wait for him. However, he tells her to go to Cornwall without him. She tells him that they will keep in touch, but as she leaves the village in a taxi, Max deletes her number from his mobile phone.
==Phyllis King== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Phyllis King |portrayer=Shelia Burrell |years=2005, 2007 |first=3 January 2005 |last=9 October 2007 |family= [[King family]] |nieces/nephews = [[Tom King (Emmerdale)|Tom King]] }} '''Phyllis King''' is [[Tom King (Emmerdale)|Tom King]]âs aunt. She appeared in 2005 and 2007. Phyllis first appears for the for Tom's ill-fated wedding to [[Charity Dingle|Charity Tate]]. Often complaining, Phyllis only seems happy to see her favourite great-nephew [[Carl King|Carl]]. She returns later in October 2005 for [[Max King (Emmerdale)|Max]]âs funeral and in February 2007 for Tomâs funeral. She made her most recent appearance at [[Jimmy King|Jimmy]]'s ill-fated wedding to [[Kelly Windsor]] in October 2007.
==Libby Charles== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Libby Charles |portrayer=Ty Glaser |years=2005 |first=9 January 2005 |last=18 July 2005 |occupation=Receptionist |siblings=[[List of minor Emmerdale characters (2005)#Tasmin Charles|Tamsin Charles]] }} '''Libby Charles''' was the girlfriend of [[Andy Sugden]]. She appeared in 2005. Libby and her sister Tamsin are first glimpsed on horseback by Andy and his younger brother [[Daz Eden|Daz]]. The sisters come from money, and Libby asks Andy about renting out his stables. Andy hopes for a date, but is disappointed to learn she has a boyfriend. Libby begins working as a receptionist at the vets and has to fend off the flirtations of [[Max King (Emmerdale)|Max King]]. When she loses interest in her boyfriend, she begins dating Andy. She's rattled when she learns he had a relationship with underage [[Debbie Dingle]], but she and Andy become closer and closer, with Libby even planning to open a business on his farm, giving pony rides to children. Their happy relationship ends when Andy learns Debbie has given birth to his child. Andy wants to do right by the baby, so he breaks up with Libby to be with Debbie. Libby puts up a good front, but is clearly hurt. A few weeks later, she announces her plans to spend the summer in Italy with her sister Tamsin. She offers to give Paddy her notice, but he fires her with immediate effect and she leaves.
==Tamsin Charles== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Tamsin Charles |portrayer=Jenny Gleave |years=2005 |first=9 January 2005 |last=23 June 2005 |siblings=[[List of minor Emmerdale characters (2005)#Libby Charles|Libby Charles]] }} '''Tamsin Charles''' is the sister of [[Libby Charles]]. She appeared in 2005. Tamsin first appeared on horseback with Libby, but the two girls have very different personalities. Tamsin has little time for quaint village life or a hard day's work. Her father forces her to get a job, but her stint as secretary for the Kings is short-lived, as she is more interested in using the computer to shop for shoes. When the Woolpack is desperate for a new barmaid, Tamsin is hired, but spends most of her time on breaks. After repeatedly clashing with barman [[Paul Lambert (Emmerdale)|Paul Lambert]], Tamsin quits her job before he can fire her, and storms out of the pub.
==Moira Stanley== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Moira Stanley |portrayer=Kate Hampson |years=2005 |first=23 January 2005 |last=7 February 2005 }} '''Moira Stanley''' was the cellmate of [[Steph Stokes]]. She appeared in 2005. When Steph is remanded in prison to await trial for the murder of [[Shelley Williams]], she shares a cell with Moira. Steph has very little patience with Moira, who is very clingy and insecure. At one point Steph tells curate [[Ethan Blake]] that Moira reminds her of Shelley. Steph is freed when Shelley turns up alive and decides not to press charges. As a goodbye gift, Steph gives Moira her radio.
==Steven Dickinson== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Steven Dickinson |portrayer=Oliver Hingston |years=2005 |first=25 January 2005 |last=4 February 2005 |occupation=[[Lawyer]] }} '''Steven Dickinson''' is a lawyer. He appeared in 2005. Steven represents Steph when she is accused of the presumed murder of [[Shelley Williams]]. Steph makes his job difficult, as she moves in and out of sanity and cannot remember whether or not she killed Shelley. After a few weeks, Shelley turns up alive and Steph is freed.
==Marian Winters== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Marian Winters |portrayer=Ann Aris |years=2005 |first=13 February 2005 |last=17 February 2005 }} '''Marian Winters''' is a widow. She appeared in 2005. Marian has recently lost her husband, and seeks counsel from curate [[Ethan Blake]] about moving away from the village, but she is unnerved by the presence of [[Steph Stokes]] and quickly exits. Soon she speaks to [[Eric Pollard]] about selling some of her belongings to help finance her move. Eric, sensing an opportunity to make money, gives her less than the actual value of her antiques so he can sell them and make a healthy profit.
==Craig Briggs== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Craig Briggs |portrayer=Nick Stanley |years=2005–2006 |first=20 February 2005 |last=26 February 2006 |occupation=[[Farmer]] |spouse=[[List of minor Emmerdale characters (2005)#Sandra Briggs|Sandra Briggs]] }} '''Craig Briggs''' is a local farmer. He appeared from 2005 to 2006, when the character was axed. Craig first appears when he asks the local vicar [[Ashley Thomas]] - who was considering leaving the ministry - to come visit his ill mother, who then passes away while seeing Ashley. Craig is a local farmer, and initially refuses [[Tom King (Emmerdale)|Tom King]]'s offer to buy his land. Craig and his wife Sandra make frequent appearances until their departures from the village in February 2006.
==Johnny Hupton== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Johnny Hupton |portrayer=[[Andrew Whitehead]] |years=2005 |first=22 February 2005 |last=2 March 2005 |occupation=Food rep }} '''Johnny Hupton''' is a food rep for "Super Fresh". He appeared in 2005. Johnny shows up at [[Viv Hope]]'s cafe for business, but Viv, recently separated from her husband, is in the mood for romance. She convinces Johnny to go on a date, but her aggressiveness causes him to flee the Woolpack within a half-hour.
==Lynda Ashby== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Lynda Ashby |portrayer=Deborah Cooley Chad |years=2005 |first=18 March 2005 |last=16 June 2005 |occupation=B&B manager }} '''Lynda Ashby''' was an old girlfriend of [[Matthew King (Emmerdale)|Matthew King]]. She appeared in 2005. When Matthew, [[Louise Appleton]], and [[Terry Woods (Emmerdale)|Terry Woods]] decide to open a bed and breakfast, they agree to check out Moorview B&B, run by Lynda Ashby. Terry has a scheduling conflict, so Matthew and Louise dine alone, as a jealous Lynda looks on. Several months later, Matthew and Louise return for a brief tryst. Lynda remarks to Matthew that he's been too busy to drop by, and as he looks at a pregnant Lynda, he smirks and says she's obviously been otherwise engaged as well.
==Kayleigh Gibbs== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Kayleigh Gibbs |portrayer=[[Lily Jane Stead]] |parents=[[Martin Crowe (Emmerdale)|Martin Crowe]] |years=2005– |first=30 March 2005 |last= }} '''Kayleigh Gibbs''' is a friend of [[Victoria Sugden]]. She has appeared since 2005. Kayleigh's father, [[Martin Crowe (Emmerdale)|DC Martin Crowe]], is a police officer. She helps him to woo [[Louise Appleton]] and they soon move in with Louise. Kayleigh and Victoria enjoy winding Louise up. Martin finds out that Louise once killed a man, and decides he cannot stay with her, so he and Kayleigh move out. He does not tell Kayleigh the real reason he has left Louise, and months later she returns and asks Louise why they split up. Louise lies and says things just did not work out and Kayleigh, not believing her, says she never wants to see her again. Although she no longer lives in the village, Kayleigh is still friends with Victoria and appears with her. Together they have sneaked into clubs, and egged the post office, causing a pregnant [[Viv Hope]] to collapse. In November 2008, Victoria and Kayleigh get money off various people in order to buy tickets to a New Year's Party, and in December is seen when Aaron Livesy is bullying Victoria.
==Sian Harper== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Sian Harper |portrayer=Maeve Larkin |years=2005 |first=22 March 2005 |last=3 April 2005 |occupation=Sales }} '''Sian Harper''' is an acquaintance of [[Matthew King (Emmerdale)|Matthew King]]. She appeared in 2005 in the Woolpack. A few weeks later, Matthew invites her for dinner with himself, [[Terry Woods (Emmerdale)|Terry Woods]]. When Sian realises becomes angry and leaves soon after dinner.
==Ivy Lynch== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Ivy Lynch |portrayer=Mags Gannon |years=2005 |first=13 April 2005 |last=21 April 2005 |children = Phil Lynch }} '''Ivy Lynch''' is a customer of [[Scott Windsor]]. She appeared in 2005. Scott needs a car for his girlfriend [[Dawn Woods]] to practice driving lessons in. When Ivy, whom he takes as an easily manipulated old woman, stops by the garage for repairs, he convinces her that her car is a death trap he can generously buy from her. She sells him the car at a cheap price, but several days later, a furious Ivy and her muscular son Phil confront Scott and Dawn. When Dawn learns what Scott has done, she gives them the car and as compensation, also gives them some of the money they try to return to Scott.
==Ivan Jones== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Ivan Jones |portrayer=[[Daniel Brocklebank]] |years=2005–2006 |first=5 May 2005 |last=2 August 2006 |romances=[[Paul Lambert (Emmerdale)|Paul Lambert]] }} '''Ivan Jones''' is [[Paul Lambert (Emmerdale)|Paul Lambert]]'s boyfriend. He appeared from 2005 to 2006. Ivan is a bisexual binman for "King & Sons" who arrives in Emmerdale after breaking up from his wife. She had caught him in bed with a man, and told the whole community he was gay, and he leaves after suffering homophobic abuse. He does not want to tell the villagers about his sexuality, and has a fling with [[Toni Daggert]]. However, he soon starts a relationship with gay Paul Lambert, but does not want anyone else to know about the relationship, which Paul finds this difficult. After Paul does in his drag queen act in "The Woolpack", he and Ivan have an argument in the toilets. Unbeknown to them, Paul's microphone is still on and the whole village soon knows about them. Ivan lives with Paul's sister [[Nicola De Souza|Nicola Blackstock]] and her former fiancee [[Simon Meredith]]. Nicola fancies Ivan and tries to steal him off Paul. When Ivan knocks her back, Nicola lies and tells everyone they had an affair. Although disappointed by everyone believing her, he still loves Paul but he rejects Ivan. He goes to live with friends for a while and when he returns he is made haulage manager for [[Matthew King (Emmerdale)|Matthew]] and [[Sadie King]]'s new business. However, he soon gets fed up with the job and along with Simon they leave Emmerdale for a new life in [[Costa Rica]].
==Juliet Garside== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Juliet Garside |portrayer=Jo Ellis |years=2005 |first=22 May 2005 |last=23 May 2005 }} '''Juliet Garside''' is a receptionist at King & Sons. She appeared in 2005. After the departure of [[Chloe Atkinson]], Tom King goes through several receptionists, including Juliet. Tom admires Juliet's work and is disappointed, if not surprised, when she tells him she has to quit because of sexual harassment from Jimmy King.
==Neville Gunn== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Neville Gunn |portrayer=Trevor Williams |years=2005 |first=27 May 2005 |last=29 May 2005 }} '''Neville Gunn''' is an acquaintance of [[Chastity Dingle]]. He appeared in 2005. Chastity's old flame [[Carl King]] takes her out for a drink, and she runs into Neville, an old friend from her days as a stripper. Carl plans to take Chas back to his place, but Neville joins them, and Neville and Chas spend most of the night laughing over old times.
==Isla Forsythe== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Isla Forsythe |portrayer=Sarah Griffiths |years=2005, 2006 |spouse=[[Adam Forsythe]] (–2005) |first=24 October 2005 |last=12 November 2006 }} '''Isla Forsythe''' is the ex-wife of [[Adam Forsythe]]. She appeared in 2005 and 2006. Isla first appears in 2005, to amicably end her marriage to Adam. In November 2006, she informs Adamâs father-in-law [[Alan Turner (Emmerdale)|Alan Turner]] that he has committed suicide while in prison.
==Effie Harrison== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Effie Harrison |portrayer=[[Phillipa Peak]] |years=2005 |first=29 May 2005 |last=20 September 2005 |occupation=[[Nanny]] }} '''Effie Harrison''' is [[List of minor Emmerdale characters (2003)#Jean Tate|Jean Tate]]'s live-in [[nanny]]. She appeared in 2005. Effie is hired by [[Zoe Tate]] to live in Home Farm and look after her daughter Jean. Effie and Zoe become close, and Effie initially supports Zoe as she faces an attempted murder trial - after an altercation with Jean's father [[Scott Windsor]] - but their friendship splinters when Effie turns down Zoe's romantic advances and plea to run away with the kids. As Zoe becomes more erratic, Effie begins to doubt her innocence, and takes an offer from [[Sadie King]] to double-cross Zoe. Effie abruptly becomes lovers with Zoe and persuades her to revive the idea of leaving with the children. At the getaway spot, Effie and Jean are nowhere to be found, but Sadie is there, and she forces Zoe to sell her Home Farm. When Zoe returns home, Effie pleads with her to understand, but Zoe punches her. After Zoe evicts Effie, she asks Sadie for the Â£10,000 she was promised. Sadie instead throws a few pieces of change onto the street - "30 pieces of silver" - and tells Effie that Zoe is more of a woman than she'll ever be. Effie is left on her hands and knees, scrounging for change.
==Rose Meyers== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Rose Meyers |portrayer=Charlotte West-Oram |years=2005 |first=19 May 2005 |last=29 June 2005 |occupation=Postmistress }} '''Rose Meyers''' is a temporary postmistress. She appeared in 2005. Rose is a postmistress who covers for [[Viv Hope|Viv Windsor]] at the Post Office during May and June 2005.
==Sarah Sugden== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Sarah Sugden |portrayer=Unknown (2005-07)

[[List of minor Emmerdale characters (2004)#Noah Tate|Noah Tate]] (half)
Kyle (half) |first=6 June 2005 |last= |classification=[[List of Emmerdale characters|Current; recurring]] }} '''Sarah Charity Sugden''' is the daughter of [[Andy Sugden]] and [[Debbie Dingle]]. She has appeared since 2005. When Debbie discovers her pregnancy, she conceals it and plans to abandon the child at the hospital once she had given birth. However, she has the baby in a shed assisted by [[Daz Eden]] â Sarahâs uncle â and names the child after Andyâs adoptive mother [[Sarah Sugden]] and her own mother [[Charity Dingle|Charity]]. Debbie decides that, at 15 years old, she cannot cope with being a mother and gives Sarah to her foster mother [[Emily Kirk]], who leaves the village with her. Eventually Emily returns Sarah after curate [[Ethan Blake]] convinces her that Andy should be allowed custody of Sarah. Debbie agrees to allow Andy custody and Sarah lives at Butlerâs Farm. Andy remained suspicious of Emily, and in July 2007, he is furious when he finds out that she has applied for a job at Sarahâs pre-school. Emily leaves the village later that year. In October 2007, [[Lisa Dingle]] tries to get Debbie to take responsibility for Sarah after Debbie and Sarah spend the afternoon together. However, Debbie refuses and says she would be happy to allow [[Jo Sugden|Jo]] to adopt her. However, Debbie cannot bring herself to sign them. In early 2008, Andy is sent to prison and in his absence, Debbie starts bonding with Sarah. After his release, he finds out that Jo has allowed Debbie access to Sarah, and hits Jo. This begins months of abuse by Andy, sending Jo to hospital on two occasions. Sarah senses the problems, and is banned from nursery after biting another child. Eventually Andy moves out, leaving Sarah with Jo but she misses Andy and he is allowed to see her. When Andy seems reformed, Jo discovers that he is sabotaging farm equipment so she would ask him to visit. Jo decides to leave the village and does so, on 22 December 2008. Reluctantly she leaves Sarah with the Dingles, asking them to keep her away from Andy. Debbie is, by this time, a lot closer to her daughter, but refuses to take custody, because â unknown to the Dingles â she is worried about being arrested for her part in the murder of [[List of minor Emmerdale characters (2008)#Shane Doyle|PC Shane Doyle]]. In January 2009, Debbie is imprisoned awaiting trial for Shane's murder. In February, Andy is allowed to have Sarah for the night, following the funeral of his adoptive father [[Jack Sugden]]. However, the following day, Andy rings the police to report [[Cain Dingle]]'s return, and Cain is caught entering the UK, so the Dingles refuse to allow Andy to see Sarah. However, after talking to Diane, the Dingles allow Andy to take Sarah home. In June, after a bitter custody battle, Debbie was awarded custody of Sarah after Andy withdrew his application. In 2011, Debbie and Andy are worried, as Sarah starts to develop multiple bruising on her skin, and complains of feeling tired. Debbie at first worries that someone may be hurting Sarah, even questioning [[Cameron Murray (Emmerdale)|Cameron Murray]] ([[Dominic Power]]), but eventually books an appointment at the hospital.
==DI Kara Warren== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Kara Warren |portrayer=[[Julie Saunders]] |years=2005 |first=22 June 2005 |last=22 September 2005 |occupation=Detective Inspector }} '''Detective Inspector Kara Warren''' was a local police officer. She appeared in 2005. When [[Scott Windsor]] is left comatose from [[Zoe Tate]]'s multiple injections of ketamine, Warren eventually comes to the conclusion that rather than defending herself from attack, Zoe planned to kill Scott. Zoe is put on trial. After the case collapses, Warren offers to help Zoe if she wants to prosecute Scott for attempted rape, but Zoe isn't interested.
==Neil DePaul== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Neil DePaul |portrayer=[[Martin Troakes]] |years=2005 |first=22 June 2005 |last=22 September 2005 |occupation=Solicitor }} '''Neil DePaul''' is a solicitor. He appeared in 2005. When [[Zoe Tate]] is in legal trouble for nearly killing [[Scott Windsor]], she assumes longtime family lawyer and friend Rachel Whatmore will represent her, but Rachel is out of the country. Neil DePaul is sent in her place. Neil does his best to defend Zoe, and his furious questioning of Scott Windsor during the trial leads Scott to admit he had planned to rape Zoe, which invalidated his previous story and helped lead to a dismissal of charges against Zoe.
==Jay Aswar== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Jay Aswar |portrayer=Guy Rhys |years=2005 |first=17 July 2005 |last=27 September 2005 |occupation=Textile buyer |romances=[[Delilah Dingle]] }} '''Jay Aswar''' is former fiance to [[Delilah Dingle]]. He appeared in 2005. Del Dingle flees to the Dingle homestead while still in her wedding dress, but is short on answers as to why. A comment Del makes in jest leads [[Zak Dingle]] and [[Cain Dingle]] to assume he beat her, and when Jay shows up to try to talk to Del, she has to stop them from roughing him up. Del explains to Jay that while she does care about him, she doesn't want to settle down with anyone. They part on friendly terms, so much so that she gives his name to her employer [[Val Lambert]] when Val needs to sell fabrics.
==Avril Kent== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Avril Kent |portrayer=[[Melanie Hill]] |years=2005 |first=26 July 2005 |last=23 August 2005 |romances=[[Bob Hope (Emmerdale)|Bob Hope]] (2005) }} '''Avril Kent''' is a brief love interest of [[Bob Hope (Emmerdale)|Bob Hope]]. She appeared in 2005. Avril is a temporary love interest for Bob Hope after his divorce from [[Viv Hope|Viv]]. Similar to Viv in many ways, Avril and Bob are happy for a while, but Bob and Viv soon get back together and re-marry in 2006.
==Sandra Briggs== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Sandra Briggs |portrayer=[[Sally Ann Matthews]] |years=2005–2006 |first=11 August 2005 |last=26 February 2006 |occupation=[[Machinist]] |spouse=[[List of minor Emmerdale characters (2005)#Craig Briggs|Craig Briggs]] }} '''Sandra Briggs''' is the wife of Craig Briggs. She appeared from 2005 to 2006, when the character was axed. Sandra is married to Craig, a local farmer. When [[Tom King (Emmerdale)|Tom King]] wants to buy their land, he sends his son [[Max King (Emmerdale)|Max]], a vet, to kill their livestock. Sandra and Craig are furious with the Kings but are unable to tell the police for insurance reasons, so Max's boss [[Paddy Kirk]] takes the blame. Sandra needs more money so she gets a job at [[Eric Pollard]]'s factory as a machinist. She works with [[Val Pollard|Val Lambert]] and [[Delilah Dingle]].
==Jimmy Pepper== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Jimmy Pepper |portrayer=Michael Gunn |years=2005 |first=2005 |first=23 August 2005 |last=7 September 2005 |romances=[[Val Pollard|Val Lambert]] |children=[[List of minor Emmerdale characters (2007)#Sharon Lambert|Sharon Lambert]]
Shane Pepper
Dane Pepper }} '''Jimmy Pepper''' is a former partner of [[Val Pollard]]. He appeared in 2005. Val and Jimmy had a relationship in the 1970s, and he was thought to the father of [[Paul Lambert (Emmerdale)|Paul Lambert]] and [[List of minor Emmerdale characters (2007)#Sharon Lambert|Sharon Lambert]]. He beat Paul and was generally a terrible father, but paid Val thousands of pounds in maintenance. However, in 2005 he learns that he is not the father of Paul, who is actually the result of an affair Val had with her brother-in-law [[Rodney Blackstock]]. Paul had learnt this in 2004. Jimmy is annoyed by this as had given Val money for Paul's upbringing, and he tells Val he will give Paul another vicious beating if Val does not pay up. Finally, Val uses money she steals from "The Woolpack" - her sister [[Diane Sugden|Diane]]'s pub.
==Delphine LaClair== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Delphine LaClair |portrayer=[[Brigit Forsyth]] |years=2005 |first=15 September 2005 |last=16 September 2005 |occupation=Sales representative }} '''Delphine LaClair''' is a sales representative. She appeared in 2005. When [[Rodney Blackstock]] plans to sell his vineyards to a French company, Delphine is their representative. Rodney assumes she will be a young woman, and plans a romantic pursuit, but is discomifted when they meet, as she is his age. She's interested in him but he demurs. A few weeks later, Delphine is supposed to return to finalize details, but instead, her associates, who do not speak English, arrive at the B&B and cause a great deal of confusion for [[Steph Stokes]].
==Aubrey Bedford== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Aubrey Bedford |portrayer=Richard Mullins |years=2005 |first=15 September 2005 |last=20 September 2005 |occupation=Realtor }} '''Aubrey Bedford''' is a realtor. He appeared in 2005. When [[Rodney Blackstock]] is trying to buy Home Farm, he decides to sell his house. Aubrey looks around the house, but is more interested in Rodney's son [[Paul Lambert]]. To get Aubrey away from Paul, Rodney agrees to flirt with Aubrey. Aubrey likes older men, so Rodney's attentions make him more invested in helping Rodney. Ultimately the sale does not go through because Rodney does not get Home Farm.
==Noreen Bell== {{Infobox soap character |series=Emmerdale |color=#99CCCC |name=Noreen Bell |portrayer=[[Jenny Tomasin]] |years=2005–2006 |dob= |first=September 2005 |last=13 July 2006 |death=13 July 2006 |cousins=[[List of minor Emmerdale characters (2006)#Gilbert Duff|Gilbert Duff]] }} '''Noreen Doreen Bell''' is a pensioner who befriends [[Val Pollard|Val Lambert]]. She appeared from 2005 to 2006. Noreen first appears as a cantankerous pensioner who irrates Val Lambert when the latter is doing community service in late 2005. Noreen lives on the far side of the village in Tall Trees Cottage, and wears a wig and fake eyebrows. Noreen later strikes up a mutual friendship with Val and [[Sandy Thomas]]. Noreen dies on 13 July 2006 when she is having a look around the [[Major_Emmerdale_storylines#Kings_River_explosion_July_2006|Kings' show home]]. She opens a cupboard door and is blasted by a gas explosion, killing her instantly. In her will, she left her money to Val and her thimble collection to her second cousin [[List of minor Emmerdale characters (2006)#Gilbert Duff|Gilbert Duff]].
